chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Valentina R Skurek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall maintain absolute subriety; defendant shall submit to random screens to determine compliance.
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including AODA assessment/treatment.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State. State moves to amend to Operate a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent contrary to Sec. 943.23(3m) - misdemeanor. Court so orders. State does not object to expungement. Def. pleads guilty & Court finds defendant guilty. Statements by Atty. Bensen, Atty. Romanowich, and defendant. Court proceeds to sentencing. Court denies request for expungement.

Atty Katherine Romanowich appearing for Def.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Counsel requests a stayed warrant.  Warrant stayed until adjourned date.  Hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Defendant has an OWI first pending with pretrial scheduled.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Sent certified copy of Bail/Bond w/invoice to Sheboygan Co DA per request recd 8-20-14
